10 years and it is still one of my favourites

It's easier to say go play it for yourself instead of trying to point out all the incredible aspects of this game which by the way are quite a few. This is a perfect continuation of my favourite game or should I say this is my favourite game too since both 1 & 2 go hand in hand, but I digress.
Let me put it this way - had I not known about the existence of such a masterpiece until now I'd have beaten myself in the head for missing out on the opportunity to play it when it came out.
So glad that being a Valve fanboy I've always been up to date with their latest work and also growing up on such amazing games during the golden decade of fps.
not a gamer if you don't have

I tried to alt tab out of the game and it crashed

if I had never played portal 1 I would think this game is brilliant
instead I'm greeted with tedium in the single player
Portal's story should probably never have had a follow up and this really really really shows that to be true
and being forced to go through baby puzzles for the first hour of play as the game catches up to what I'm used to from the first one is just painful, so it's not like the single player is even a good level pack for players of the first game

and then I could no longer progress in the single player because the fucking game produced some weird glitch where I was constantly shooting out the blue portal and couldn't fire the orange one
after searching around and getting past that
I got stuck at the start of chapter 7 because it just wouldn't load the stage past the elevator you start in
and there isn't a chapter select so I couldn't just restart from the start of the chapter

oh well


that said the couch co-op is bomb (played it on an xbox) and the music is fire

Absolutely amazing game!
The only 'flaw' that sticks out to me, is that depending on your computer, the resolution may be wrong.
But this can easily be fixed by going to the video settings!
Wouldn't play this for even a minute!

It's hard to write about a masterpiece of this game in a way others haven't, simply because this game has little flaws and is an incredibly enjoyable experience. The story of this game is elevated greatly from the first and explores more of the infamous Aperture Science Laboratories with GLADOS as the villain and being amazing one without a doubt. However my main enjoyment of this game comes from the Co-Op mode. My buddy and I would spend hours trying to solve countless difficult levels provided by the steam workshop, we would laugh, we would argue, and we would realize we are stupid at times for missing easy solutions. 

To sum up the review I would say that this game is worth it 100% since the price is great, and sometimes on sale, but the enjoyment from the story or the co-op is just a blast and half. I'm excited to see if we receive sometime similar in the future from Valve, but here is to hoping.
